shortdesc.ph: Represents time consumption metrics for each stage during video frame rendering.
Collects key metrics for the video frame rendering process.

plentry.pd: Time interval (ms) from calling to SDK triggering the callback. Agora recommends calling before joining the channel.
Time interval (ms) from calling to calling joinChannel. If this value is negative, it means was called after joinChannel.
Time interval (ms) from calling joinChannel to successfully joining the channel.

Time interval (ms) from successfully joining the channel to the remote user joining, or from calling to the remote user joining, depending on when you call . If you call after the remote user joins, this value is 0 and meaningless. To reduce the remote user’s first frame rendering time, Agora recommends joining the channel when the remote user is already in the channel to reduce this value.

Time interval (ms) from the remote user joining the channel to setting the remote view, or from calling to setting the remote view, depending on when you call . If you call after setting the remote view, this value is 0 and invalid. To reduce the remote user’s first frame rendering time, Agora recommends setting the remote view before the remote user joins the channel or immediately after they join to reduce this value.

Time interval (ms) from the remote user joining the channel to you subscribing to the remote video stream, or from calling to subscribing to the remote video stream, depending on when you call . If you call after subscribing to the remote video stream, this value is 0 and invalid. To reduce the remote user’s first frame rendering time, Agora recommends subscribing to the remote video stream immediately after the remote user joins the channel to reduce this value.

Time interval (ms) from the remote user joining the channel to you receiving the remote video stream, or from calling to receiving the remote video stream, depending on when you call . If you call after receiving the remote video stream, this value is 0 and invalid. To reduce the remote user’s first frame rendering time, Agora recommends the remote user publish the video stream immediately after joining the channel and you subscribe to it immediately to reduce this value.
Time interval from calling to the SDK triggering the callback, in milliseconds. Agora recommends calling before joining the channel.
Time interval from calling to calling joinChannel, in milliseconds. If negative, it indicates joinChannel was called before .
Time interval from calling joinChannel to successfully joining the channel, in milliseconds.

If the local user calls before successfully joining the channel, this field indicates the time interval from the local user joining the channel to the remote user joining, in milliseconds. If the local user calls after joining the channel, it indicates the time interval from calling to the remote user joining, in milliseconds. If the local user calls after the remote user has joined the channel, this value is 0 and has no practical meaning. To reduce the first frame rendering time for the remote user, Agora recommends allowing the local user to join the channel after the remote user has joined, to minimize this value.

If the local user calls before the remote user joins the channel, this field indicates the time interval from the remote user joining to the local user setting the remote view, in milliseconds. If the local user calls after the remote user has joined, it indicates the time interval from calling to setting the remote view, in milliseconds. If the local user calls after setting the remote view, this value is 0 and invalid. To reduce the remote user's first frame rendering time, Agora recommends setting the remote view before the remote user joins the channel or immediately after the remote user joins, to minimize this value.

If the local user calls before the remote user joins the channel, this field indicates the time interval from the remote user joining to the local user subscribing to the remote video stream, in milliseconds. If the local user calls after the remote user has joined, it indicates the time interval from calling to subscribing to the remote video stream, in milliseconds. If is called after the local user subscribes to the remote video stream, this value is 0 and invalid. To reduce the remote user's first frame rendering time, Agora recommends subscribing to the remote video stream immediately after the remote user joins the channel, to shorten this value.

If the local user calls before the remote user joins the channel, this field indicates the time interval from the remote user joining to the local user receiving the remote video, in milliseconds. If the local user calls after the remote user has joined, it indicates the time interval from calling to receiving the remote video stream, in milliseconds. If the local user calls after receiving the remote video stream, this value is 0 and invalid. To reduce the remote user's first frame rendering latency, Agora recommends the remote user send video immediately after joining the channel, and the local user subscribe to the video stream immediately, to minimize this value.
